bslices.desc: Temperature calibration value
bslices.info:
\n

Formula for temperature:

T (deg. C) = (\"ADC-value\" * 0.5869 - 418) / (\"Register value\" * 0.5869 - 418) * 145 - 40

ADC-value: the ADC-value of the temperature sensor

Register value: value stored in this register

<html>
  <body>
  </body>

bslices.name: EN
bslices.desc: Enable e-fuse
bslices.info:
\n
Note:
  • RFT0:FRTSIGCLK_DIV is set to 4000D
  • RFT0:ID and RFT1:ID is used for programming data
  • SYS_CLK is enabled
  • RF signals of RFT0 and RFT1 are isolated to reset value
\n

bslices.name: SENSE
bslices.desc: Start e-fuse read sequence
bslices.info: Note: Reading is done with the configured sense margin values.

bslices.name: PRG
bslices.desc: Start e-fuse program sequence
bslices.info: Note: Programming data are taken from RFT0:ID and RFT1:ID registers.

bslices.name: SENSE_L
bslices.desc: Enable low sense margin for production test
bslices.info: Note: Sense margin high and low are mutually exclusive.

bslices.name: SENSE_H
bslices.desc: Enable high sense margin for production test
bslices.info: Note: Sense margin high and low are mutually exclusive.

bslices.name: LOCKED
bslices.desc: E-fuse locked: indicates that the e-fuses have already been written
bslices.info:
\n

Note: Only valid after EFUSE_SENSE was executed.

\n

bslices.name: READY
bslices.desc: E-fuse ready: indicates that the e-fuses have been sensed
bslices.info:
\n

Note: Only valid after SENSE was executed!

\n

bslices.desc: E-fuse clock divider

bslices.name: DFT_TRIG_EN
bslices.desc: Enable the ADC for manually triggered conversions.
bslices.info:
\n
Enable the ADC.

Sequence:
  • Trigger comes in from SW (CONF\\ADC_TRIG) or external pin (DFT_TRIG_MAP)
  • Set MUX channels from DFT_ADC_MUX and SENSE_CONF\\CONV1_SEL
  • Wait 40 clock cycles for MUX channel to settle
  • Convert with the ADC settings given by the MUX channel (IQ or sensor). For ADC MUX = 0D, sensor settings will be used.
\n

enums.desc: Disables external trigger for ADC triggering
Enables external trigger for ADC triggering

bslices.name: VAL
bslices.desc: Multiplication value before dividing by 128
bslices.info:
Value to multiply I- or Q-channel measurements
0D ... value = 0
1D ... value = 1/128
...
127D ... value = 127/128
To avoid introduction of offsett by this amplitude change the ADC-data is treated as signed: out = ((adc - 2048) * val / 128) +2048
